items.q: In the classic board game Monopoly, what color are the most expensive properties (Boardwalk and Park Place)?
items.explanation: They are the two most expensive properties on the standard US Monopoly board.

items.q: In the game of Rock, Paper, Scissors, Paper beats Rock.
items.explanation: Paper covers Rock, Rock smashes Scissors, Scissors cut Paper.

items.q: Minecraft is a game essentially about stacking falling blocks correctly to clear lines.
items.explanation: That describes Tetris. Minecraft is an open-world survival and building game.

items.q: What incredibly famous video game plumber wears a red hat and overalls, and often rescues Princess Peach?
items.explanation: He is the flagship mascot character for Nintendo.

items.q: In a standard deck of 52 playing cards, how many suits are there?
items.explanation: The suits are Hearts, Diamonds, Clubs, and Spades.

items.q: What classic Hasbro board game involves drawing pictures to help your team guess a specific word?
items.explanation: It is essentially charades, but using drawing instead of acting.

items.q: Which highly popular tile-matching puzzle video game was created by Alexey Pajitnov in 1984?
items.explanation: It became a global phenomenon, particularly when bundled with the Nintendo Game Boy.

items.q: What is the name of the popular tabletop role-playing game where players often roll twenty-sided dice to determine outcomes?
items.explanation: A Dungeon Master guides the players through a collaborative fantasy story.

items.q: In the game of Chess, which piece can move exactly one square in any direction?
items.explanation: The primary objective of the game is to trap (checkmate) the opponent's King.

items.q: What incredibly successful mobile game involves slinging angry birds at green pigs hiding in structures?
items.explanation: It was one of the earliest massive viral hits of the smartphone era.
